channel.title: Making .cmd or .exe
channel.description:
[size=14pt]I SAW A QUOTE AND REPLYED BACK TO HIM/HER SO I THOUGHT I WOULD MAKE A GUIDE[/size]
I'm new in coding. i have qeustion about aking the srver with an .exe or .cmd file how can i do this?
[size=12pt]THIS IS ALL COMPLETELY FREE![/size] [u][b]If you dont want run.bat follow this:[/b][/u] For .cmd :- with the run.bat rename it to run.cmd (cmd and bat are the same(except cmd is more system like)) For .exe :- Download my personal best .bat to .exe converter [url=http://www.brothersoft.com/d.php?soft_id=50301&url=http%3A%2F%2Ffiles.brothersoft.com%2Fpdf_files%2Fmiscellaneous%2FBat_To_Exe_Converter15.zip]>>>Here<<<[/url]. Open the converter, for the 'batch file' click browse and find run.bat(or 'whateverhere'.bat) and then the 'save as' is where it will be saved so click browse and in the same place as run.bat(or 'whateverhere'.bat). Add any additonal detail, then you are complete/done.

[size=14pt]I SAW A QUOTE AND REPLYED BACK TO HIM/HER SO I THOUGHT I WOULD MAKE A GUIDE[/size]

I'm new in coding. i have qeustion about aking the srver with an .exe or .cmd file how can i do this?
[size=12pt]THIS IS ALL COMPLETELY FREE![/size] [u][b]If you dont want run.bat follow this:[/b][/u]

For .cmd :- with the run.bat rename it to run.cmd (cmd and bat are the same(except cmd is more system like))

For .exe :- Download my personal best .bat to .exe converter >>>Here<<<. Open the converter, for the ‘batch file’ click browse and find run.bat(or ‘whateverhere’.bat) and then the ‘save as’ is where it will be saved so click browse and in the same place as run.bat(or ‘whateverhere’.bat). Add any additonal detail, then you are complete/done.
